intro: Chelonanthera longifolia, commonly known as the long-flowered chelonanthera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, upright stems that bear umbel-like inflorescences with small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is often considered a rare and specialized species within its native habitat.
